column1: In a cool environment

column1: The observed attenuation of LPS-induced and stress-associated fevers in Zucker fatty rats in the cold agrees with the literature data showing that brown adipose tissue ( the major heat production effector ) is morphologically and functionally defective in these rats .

275	Cell lines of human T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemias ( T-ALL ) have gained high interest for study of mechanisms of cytostatic drug resistance .

column2: they should also be suited to examine the validity and reliability of molecular cytogenetic techniques in detecting genomic alterations in neoplastic cells .

column2: comparative genomic hybridization ( CGH ) and 24-color-fluorescence-in-situ-hybridization ( M-FISH ) were applied to eight sublines of CCRF-CEM leukemia cells selected in vitro for drug resistance and to their drug-sensitive parental counterparts .

column1: All cell lines were characterized by altered chromosome numbers and by a variety of chromosomal structural aberrations as shown by M-FISH .

Interestingly
column2: a considerable number of the rearrangements found were imbalanced .

column2: a del(9)(p21pter) in all lines examined
column3: and a gain of chromosome 20 in 9 of the 10 lines examined were readily detected by both techniques .

column1: The same held true for losses of chromosomes 17 and 18 in the near tetraploid cell lines which could also be confirmed by CGH .
Some imbalances of genomic material detected by CGH were
column2: however
column3: not observed by means of M-FISH
column4: possibly due to the limited extension of the corresponding chromosomal segment involved or the small subpopulation of cells affected .

column1: On the other hand
column2: reciprocal translocations
column3: balanced isochromosomes
column4: and small deletions remained mainly undetected by CGH .

column1: A comparison of chromosomal alterations in drug-resistant and parental cell lines showed not only amplifications of chromosomal segments harboring well-known drug resistance genes

column3: the dihydrofolate reductase gene

column1: Thus

276	INTRODUCTION Cell-cell interaction is an essential component of atherosclerotic plaque development .

column2: not only through foam cell formation but also via the production of various growth factors that induce proliferation of different cell types that are involved in the plaque development .

column1: Using serum free co-culture method
column2: we determined the effect of monocytes on endothelial cell proliferation .

column1: METHODS Endothelial cell proliferation is determined by the amount of [ 3H]thymidine incorporated in to the DNA .
Basic fibroblast growth factor ( b-FGF )
column2: vascular endothelial growth factor ( VEGF ) and interleukin-8 ( IL-8 ) levels in the conditioned medium were determined by ELISA .

column1: RESULTS Conditioned medium from unactivated monocytes partially inhibited endothelial cell proliferation
column2: whereas conditioned medium from activated monocytes promoted endothelial cell proliferation .

column1: The mitogenic effect of conditioned medium derived from activated monocytes is due to the presence of b-FGF
column2: VEGF and IL-8 .

column1: Neutralizing antibodies against b-FGF
column2: VEGF and IL-8 partially reversed the mitogenic effect of conditioned medium derived from activated monocytes .

column1: When b-FGF
column2: VEGF and IL-8 were immunoprecipitated from conditioned medium derived from activated monocytes

column1: CONCLUSION Activated monocytes may play an important role in the development of atherosclerotic plaque by producing endothelial cell growth factors .
